leopard_id.engine package

Submodules

leopard_id.engine.trainer module

leopard_id.engine.trainer.configure_training(model, config, num_input_channels)[source]
leopard_id.engine.trainer.evaluate_data(model, outputs, targets, device, method='triplet', max_k=5, verbose=False)[source]

Evaluate the model and return the average precision, class distance ratio and top k match ratio using logging for verbose output. Gets called inside an epoch, so is returning each metric for a specific batch.

leopard_id.engine.trainer.evaluate_epoch_test(model, data_loader, device, max_k, method='triplet', verbose=True)[source]

Evaluate specifically for testing data inside an epoch. Collects outputs across batches and then evaluates them all together to compute metrics for the entire test dataset.

leopard_id.engine.trainer.train_epoch(model, data_loader, optimizer, criterion, device, max_k, epoch, method='triplet', classifier=None)[source]

Train the model for one epoch and return the average loss. Also evaluate the model with the chosen metrics on the training data. Do it in one function to avoid accessing data twice. Average metrics over all batches.

leopard_id.engine.trainer.train_model(model, train_loader, test_loader, device, config, num_input_channels, project_root)[source]

Train and evaluate the model, focusing only on the last added embedding layer. Save the model every epoch if the average precision is higher than the previous epoch, starting from the 15th epoch.
